courses.title: 101 - The Legal & Institutional Framework

overview.title: OVERVIEW
overview.description: Comprehensive foundation course covering the essential legal and institutional frameworks governing energy policy and regulation.

o Energy Conservation Act, 2001 and its Amendments

o Central Electricity Regulatory Commission (CERC) - Interstate Commerce
o State Electricity Regulatory Commissions (SERCs) - Intrastate Commerce

o National Load Dispatch Centre (NLDC) - Grid Operations
o Regional Load Dispatch Centres (RLDCs) - Regional Grid Management

o State Load Dispatch Centres (SLDCs) - State Grid Operations

o Captive Power Plants (CPPs) and Open Access Consumers
o Power Exchanges - IEX, PXIL for Short-term Trading

policyFramework.title: POLICY & REGULATORY FRAMEWORK:
items: o National Electricity Policy (NEP) 2005 and its Implementation
o National Tariff Policy (NTP) 2006 and Amendments
o Renewable Energy Policy and Solar Mission Targets
o Electricity Regulatory Commissions - Functions and Powers
o Tariff Determination Process - Multi-Year Tariff (MYT) Framework
o Cost of Service vs. Performance-Based Rate Making
o Cross-Subsidy and Subsidy Rationalization Policies
o Open Access Regulations and Wheeling Charges
o Dispute Resolution Mechanisms - Appellate Tribunal for Electricity (APTEL)
o Competition Commission of India (CCI) Role in Power Sector
o State Electricity Policy Formulation and Implementation
o Rural Electrification and Distribution Reforms

classroomSimulation.title: CLASSROOM SIMULATION:
items: o Drafting a Regulation/Order/Speaking Orders Determining Tariff
o Mock Regulatory Commission Hearing - Tariff Petition Process
o Stakeholder Consultation Process Simulation
o Electricity Bill Analysis and Consumer Grievance Resolution

o Renewable Energy Certificate (REC) Trading Simulation
o Distribution Franchise Model Case Study
o Public Hearing Simulation for Major Policy Changes

learningOutcomes: Understanding of constitutional framework for electricity regulation
Knowledge of key institutions and their roles in the power sector
Comprehension of regulatory processes and tariff determination
Practical skills in drafting regulatory documents
courses.prerequisites: Basic understanding of energy systems recommended
courses.certification: Certificate of completion upon successful assessment
